reviewText: First of all...I think it's safe to assume the three reviews below me are total rubbish, clearly from two biased MMPR fans, and one person ignorant enough to think anything resembling new episodes of Dinothunder would appear exculsivly on DVD first.Aside from that, Power Rangers enters it's twleth (and so far, greatest) season with "Day of the Dino", a two-part epic accompanied by the two-part finale of the previous season Ninja Storm.Establishing the main plot arcs almost immediatly with a thrilling battle between veteran Ranger Tommy Oliver and the forces of Mesegog on a rapidly sinking Island, to the introduction of Connor, Kira, and Ethan, three distinctly different people who are united form a Ranger team by fate to tame the Bio-Zords unleashed on the city by Mesegog.The action is non-stop, the comedy is brilliantly executed ("Don't call me dude""-Tommy) references to the original seasons (Cassidy talks about Angel Grove at one point) and the episode provides the audience with more mysteries and chilling new adversaries (Mesegog is the finest P.R villain since Ransik from Time Force and Prince Gasket from Zeo)So don't take dissapointment and MMPR preference overtake your own choices, purchase this DVD and realise that Power Rangers will continue because of seasons such as this
summary: Dinothunder defends the honour of Power Rangers

reviewText: On this dvd are the episodes Day of the Dino parts 1 and 2, and Wave Goodbye. As well as 2 episodes from Ninja Storm, a ninja moves lesson, and Dino Thunder Virtual Trading Cards. I had no problems with the disc. I am happy to have it so I can watch it anytime I want, now I just need the rest I am set. Thanks.

reviewText: I've been a huge fan of Dino thunder, especially of Jason Frank "aka tommy" ever since he appeared in the original MMPR! My son loves the series and aside from what a certain reviewer thinks it great fun and plenty of people watch them still! Thats why people know so much about it and thats why Jason Frank has such a huge fan (check out the official site, the shows bigger then anyone can imagine and rakes in cash) base from not just kids but they're parents as well. Keep them coming!

reviewText: And that was my major incentive for trying this, & it's definitely in my top 10 Power Ranger series.  And since this had bonus Ninja Storm episodes, it was like killing 2 birds with one stone.  Here's a review of the episodes, with synopsizes from Wikipedia.497-498.  Day of the Dino:  Former Veteran Power Ranger Tommy Oliver takes a teaching job at the city of Reefside years after escaping from an ordeal with the evil reptilian monster Mesogog, and is assigned to look after three detention students: Conner McKnight (soccer star), Ethan James(hi-tech prankster) and Kira Ford (singer).  During a trip to the museum, the trio stumbles upon a secret hideaway and find the magical Dino Gems.  Kira rejects her Gem soon after, only to be abducted by Mesogog's forces.  This is a great start to the season.  A499.  Wave Goodbye:  Conner resigns his position as the Red Ranger when his Ranger duties interfere with his dreams of being a soccer star and cause him to miss an important try-out.  However, he reconsiders after saving a little girl from harm and defeating Mesogog's Birdbrain mutation with a little help from his fellow Rangers and the Raptor Riders given to the Rangers by Tommy. Meanwhile, Mesogog kidnaps Tommy to force him to unleash the power from within a stone.  Not as good as the other episodes on the DVD, but not bad.  BThere's also the 2 bonus Ninja Storm episodes.495-496.  Storm Before The Calm:  The Rangers are selected to showcase their respective talents in the US Action Games. Meanwhile, Lothor prepares the final stages of a scheme set in motion by destiny itself, as he seeks to unleash the evils within The Abyss of Evil, hidden beneath the site of the Action Games.  The Rangers face their greatest challenge.  This is an excellent season finale.  I shall definitely check out the whole season on the boxset with seasons 8-12.  A+Not a bad buy for a penny plus shipping & handling.
summary: The greatest Ranger of them all is back!
